brainly_data.question: Mike owns 7 different mathematics books and 4 different computer science books and wish to fill 5 positions on a shelf. If the first 2 positions are to be occupied by math books and the last 3 by computer science books, in how many ways can this be done?
brainly_data.subject: Mathematics

all_answers.question: Mike owns 7 different mathematics books and 4 different computer science books and wish to fill 5 positions on a shelf. If the first 2 positions are to be occupied by math books and the last 3 by computer science books, in how many ways can this be done?
all_answers.subject: Mathematics
all_answers.text: If you are trying to find out how many ways you can put books on the shelf than you can make a chart or draw a picture of the situation and draw all the different ways
